abstract: Wall Street banks are pushing spinoffs to compensate for declining takeover volume, but they may find themselves facing the same pressure to split up from their own investors.
snippet: Wall Street banks are pushing spinoffs to compensate for declining takeover volume, but they may find themselves facing the same pressure to split up from their own investors.
lead_paragraph: Perhaps it is not Occupy Wall Street that the banks should fear, but their latest frothy financial product. Investment bankers are crisscrossing the nation peddling spinoffs. But given the weak stock prices of these banks, they may find themselves under the same pressure to split up from their own investors.

headline.main: Banks May Be Target of Their Own Tactic: Advocating a Breakup
